New Records: Dunith Wellalage has become the first spinner to take five wickets in an ODI against India on more than one occasion
Key Match Events: India were ALL OUT in 138 runs in just 26.1 overs. For India, skipper Rohit Sharma scored 35 off 20 balls and Washington Sundar hit 30 off 25 deliveries. Apart from this no other batter could cross 20 runs, including Virat Kohli. For Sri Lanka, Dunith Wellalage picked up 5 wickets, while Maheesh Theekshana and Jeffrey Vandersay took 2 wickets each.
Pre-Game Insights: Questions are also being asked about Virat Kohli, who has scored just 38 runs in the two matches so far.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma remarked that winning the series was a significant morale booster ahead of the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka lost 27 wickets to spin is the most by any team in a bilateral ODI series.
Others: Sri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka won the toss and decided to bat first in Colombo. Pathum Nissanka and Avishka Fernando have provided a solid start to the innings scoring 41 runs from the first 10 overs, setting a foundation for a score over 200.
